thread.title: Hollywood stabbing: Sunset Boulevard shut down after Jack in the Box rampage
thread.title_full: Hollywood stabbing: Sunset Boulevard shut down after Jack in the Box rampage

author: Rohan Smith
title: Hollywood stabbing: Sunset Boulevard shut down after Jack in the Box rampage
text:
CHAOTIC scenes unfolded at a busy and popular fast food restaurant in Hollywood today where one man was shot and three others were stabbed. 
One of the stabbing victims did not survive and died at the scene.
Video footage uploaded to social media shows the aftermath of what is believed to have been a stabbing rampage carried out by a man wielding a knife not far from the city’s famous Sunset Boulevard.
In the footage, police converge on a man in a purple shirt and pin him to the ground inside the Jack in the Box restaurant. Nearby a victim is seated in a chair, bleeding heavily on the floor while ambulance personnel search for a pulse.
The attack started just before 2pm local time at the 1400 block of North Cahuenga Boulevard, a spokeswoman for the Los Angeles Fire Department said.
Aftermath pt. 2 
A video posted by Tamiiza Vile (@tamiiza_vile) on Jan 31, 2017 at 2:30pm PST 
Margaret Stewart told reporters injuries ranged from gunshot wounds to stab wounds. Three people were taken to local hospitals, she said.
Maeve Reston, a political reporter with CNN, tweeted that the stabbing suspect was shot inside the restaurant. She wrote that before the shooting, the suspect tried to go into a coffee shop with his knife, but a customer held the glass door shut.
Just that kind of day where some guy was reportedly walking down street stabbing people outside your office, then was reportedly shot by PD
— Maeve Reston (@MaeveReston) January 31, 2017 For people in LA, alleged stabbing/shooting took place near Jack-in-the-box at Cahuenga & Sunset (across from CNN tower). So avoid the area
— Maeve Reston (@MaeveReston) January 31, 2017 B4 Hollywood stabbing suspect shot, tried to come into our fave coffee place w/ his knife, but customer held glass door shut, blocking him
— Maeve Reston (@MaeveReston) January 31, 2017 Ms Reston also tweeted she saw someone being taken from a Jack in the Box restaurant.
Local news station KTLA reported a Los Angeles Police Department spokesperson said an officer-involved shooting took place, but had no information on that and would not give further details on the investigation.
Outside the restaurant, footage shows the entire intersection sealed off with police tape as onlookers circle around.
More to come.
